titleStmt.title: An ordinance of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament: for the due and orderly receiving and collecting of the Kings, Queens, and Princes Revenue, and the arrears thereof. 21 Septemb. 1643.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Iohn Wright at the Kings Head in the Old Bayley.,

notesStmt.note: Historiated initial; Steele notation: headpiece considerati that 2)or beene

Ceratain persons on the King's authority seize money collected for the poor Protestants in Ireland. Some officers even take money to Oxford. All the King's, Queen's, and Prince's revenues are put in the hands of the receivers.... --Steele.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
